definition: to feel sick/to feel nauseous/to feel disgusted
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: They do not make me sick discussing their duty to God.
sentences.chinese: 动物们不会谈论他们对上主的义务而令我作呕。

sentences.english: The posturing before the camera on bothe sides repelled me.
sentences.chinese: 双方在摄像机前装腔作势的姿态令我作呕。

sentences.english: The posturing before the camera on both sides repelled me.
sentences.chinese: 双方在摄像机前装腔作势的姿态令我作呕。

sentences.english: Result in ever since the hellish scene of the one sea of blood corpse mountain, sickening.
sentences.chinese: 造成如今一片血海尸山的地狱场景，令人作呕。

sentences.english: She says that she feels sort of nauseated and dizzy.
sentences.chinese: 她说她感到有点作呕和头晕。

sentences.english: Necessity is the mother of invention. Turning human excreta into food is quite nauseating.
sentences.chinese: 需求是发明之母，将人类排泄物变成食物令人作呕。

sentences.english: This security company should be charged, this is disgusting.
sentences.chinese: 这家保安公司应被起诉，真是令人作呕。

sentences.english: I am reminded of that nauseating picture.
sentences.chinese: 我不由地想起那幅令人作呕的画来。

sentences.english: She was moaning and retching all the while.
Ingesting large doses may cause gastric irritation, nausea, and diarrhea.
sentences.chinese: 如服用大剂量可刺激胃部，作呕与腹泻。

sentences.english: But it nauseated him, Mr. Wu recalled in later interviews.
sentences.chinese: 但是这让他作呕，吴先生在后来的会见中回忆到。
她那装模作样劲儿真令人作呕。

sentences.english: I have lied in admitting the disgusting charges laid against my Order.
sentences.chinese: 我再那些对我的信仰邻人作呕的指控上撒了谎。

sentences.english: If all of this is making you a bit queasy, we understand.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这一切让你有点作呕的感觉，我们理解。

definition: to spoil one's appetite/fig. to get fed up with sth
to have one's hair stand on end (idiom)/to feel one's blood run cold
shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
